data.text: When dieting, it is essential to understand portion control. If you are not counting calories, overeating can be easy, especially when dieting. This article aims to provide an example of a 2300-calorie day, the average human daily intake.

Dieting can be a struggle. As humans, we are biologically
programmed to consume calories for energy. Our body wants as many calories as
possible to ensure sufficient power for life. However, food is easy to come by
nowadays, meaning we rarely have to search for it. This can lead us to always
want more and overeat calories we donâ€™t need, leading to weight gain.
Therefore, in this article, we will plan a daily diet program to ensure you
understand whether you are overeating.

This diet consists of a calorie intake for the average human. However, depending on your sex (average woman = 2000 calories / average male = 2500 calories), weight and muscle mass, this can be different. If you are personally interested in how many calories you should intake, check here with a free calorie calculator.
What should your diet consist of?

Ensure you get the right amount of dark vegetables, fruit,
whole grains, and protein sources to meet your dietary requirements. We
understand that diets can be personal and that you may want to try different
options. We have provided examples from our recipes section on the platform. Therefore, take a look at the recipes and make your own! We have
provided meat and vegetarian options; feel free to mix and match, but watch the
calories!

items: Veggie: Oatmeal pancakes with banana, walnuts and honey (469)

data.text:
For lunch, you want something light that will not spike your
blood glucose, so reduce that afternoon dip so you can carry your energy
through the day!

items: Meat: Salad with Mango, shrimp and Avocado (451)
Vegetarian: Quinoa salad with sweet potato, spinach and pomegranate seed (492)

data.text:
Getting healthy snacks in is a must throughout the day. It allows
you to top up on much-needed fruit and vegetables you may have missed. We have
paired two options with half a cup of almonds, a great source of protein with
additional health benefits!

items: Green smoothie bowl with kiwi, banana and blueberries (465)
Oatmeal muffins with apple and banana (366) if you need to reduce your calorie intake and increase your grain intake.
Pair either of these recipes (not both) with Half a cup of almonds (413.25) = 15 grams of protein.

data.text:
For dinner, make sure you get the final calories in your
body so you are not starving when you wake up. Dinner should have all the
necessary components, including vegetables, grains and proteins.

items: Meat: Chicken Breast With Green Asparagus and Grilled Avocado (556)
Vegetarian: Japanese noodle soup with tofu and egg (463)

data.text: The total calorie intake for the day of eating if you choose the green smoothie bowl:

Understanding portion control is crucial when dieting, as it
helps prevent overeating and ensures you maintain a balanced intake of
nutrients. This 2300-calorie day plan provides a structured approach to healthy
eating, offering both meat and vegetarian options. Ensure you include dark
vegetables, fruits, whole grains, and proteins to meet all dietary
requirements. By following these meal suggestions, you can manage your calorie
intake effectively without feeling deprived, sustaining your energy throughout the
day and meeting those nutritional goals!
